page.title: 01General summary of the area
page.content: This block lies within the{Oxford {Green Belt. }It is mainly rural, stretching from wooded Corallian Sandstone and Limestone escarpment to the cultivated farmland on the clay vale. Under the Structure plan any expansion of villages is restricted to infilling. Some inhabitants fear that they may become suburbs of Oxford. It is rich in history. Much of the land was owned by Abingdon Abbey. Today it is owned by Oxford colleges. The housing stock is varied:18th Century and earlier Cotswold stone dwellings are intermingled with more recent brick or reconstituted stone, ribbon or estate development. Communities are close knit. The infrastructure of support for young and old has its origins in local councils, volunteer groups and the Church.
